abstract: Judge Gregory W Pollack of San Diego Superior Court, in hearing assessing right-to-die lawsuit against state of California by cancer patient Christy O'Donnell of California and three other plaintiffs, strongly suggests suit will be dismissed; Pollack tells plaintiffs he does not have power to declare a state statute unconstitutional and suggests higher court or Legislature as proper venue for change.
lead_paragraph: In San Diego, a Superior Court judge said he would not rule against a California law that prohibits doctors from prescribing fatal medication for terminally ill people.

headline.main: Likely Setback for the Right-to-Die Cause
headline.print_headline: Likely Setback for the Right-to-Die Cause

snippet: In San Diego, a Superior Court judge said he would not rule against a California law that prohibits doctors from prescribing fatal medication for terminally ill people.
